question_text: How would you design a highly scalable, event-driven architecture on GCP to process millions of IoT sensor readings per second, ensuring reliability and minimal operational overhead?
hook_text: Scale IoT data processing to millions per second! This GCP event-driven architecture handles massive real-time streams.
cta_text: Master serverless scaling on GCP. Follow for advanced cloud architect strategies!

answer_sections.title: Ingestion & Fan-out
answer_sections.text: Pub/Sub ingests raw IoT data. Eventarc Advanced routes events flexibly. Cloud Run processes data streams, autoscaling efficiently.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Pub/Sub ingests data. Eventarc routes events. Cloud Run processes streams, autoscaling efficiently.

answer_sections.title: Orchestration & Persistence
answer_sections.text: Cloud Workflows orchestrates complex tasks. Cloud Storage archives raw data. BigQuery stores processed data for analytics.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Workflows orchestrate complex tasks. Cloud Storage archives raw data. BigQuery for analytics.

answer_sections.title: Resilience & Security
answer_sections.text: Implement idempotency with Memorystore. Use Dead-Letter Queues for failures. Apply strict IAM for least privilege access.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Idempotency with Memorystore. Dead-Letter Queues for failures. Strict IAM security.
